attributes.action: Stop overcharging barbers to play music in there shops
attributes.additional_details: Taxi drivers do not Have to pay for a music lisence even though that is there for vechile and have people in and out like  a barbershop. We should not have to pay to keep ourselves entertained while we work in our premises. Especially when it's a tiny ship.
attributes.background: Why should we have to pay hundreds of pounds to play music in our shop for our entertainment and to keep us occupied and relaxed while we work. Especially when we pay money for Spotify for the right to listen to there music already

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about the cost of licensing music for use in commercial premises but aren't sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

You could start a new petition calling for barbers and hairdressers to be exempt from requiring  music licences if that is something you would like to see happen.
